support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with GABARAP, a key protein in the autophagy pathway, to promote the early stages of autophagy.

functions.cellular_process: GABARAP is a member of the ATG8 family of ubiquitin-like proteins that are conjugated to phosphatidylethanolamine (PE) and incorporated into the autophagosomal membrane. It plays a crucial role in autophagosome maturation and closure.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 interacts with GABARAP, an ATG8 family protein, to facilitate the early steps of autophagy. This interaction likely helps in the recruitment of components to the phagophore or in the expansion and closure of the autophagosome.
biological_consequence: Interaction with GABARAP → Promotion of autophagosome maturation → Cellular degradation of substrates → Maintenance of proteostasis
specific_effects: ATXN3 interacts with ATG8 family members (LC3/GABARAP) to promote the early steps of autophagy.

evidence.paper_title: ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3

mechanism: GABARAP is a member of the ATG8 family of ubiquitin-like proteins that are conjugated to phosphatidylethanolamine (PE) and incorporated into the autophagosomal membrane. It plays a crucial role in autophagosome maturation and closure.
effect: ATXN3 interacts with GABARAP, an ATG8 family protein, to facilitate the early steps of autophagy. This interaction likely helps in the recruitment of components to the phagophore or in the expansion and closure of the autophagosome.
summary: ATXN3 activates GABARAP to modulate autophagy, ultimately affecting maintenance of proteostasis.

evidence.paper_title: The deubiquitinase ataxin-3 mediates the VCP-dependent degradation of misfolded proteins of the endoplasmic reticulum
ATXN3: a multifunctional protein involved in the polyglutamine disease spinocerebellar ataxia type 3
